name: camera.isActive
content:
Returns true if the camera is active, else returns false.

This is a read only property. Use `camera.on()` and `camera.off()` to enable or disable the camera.

The camera enables scrolling and zooming for scenes extending beyond the display area. A camera has a position, a zoom factor, and mouse coordinates relative to the view. The camera is automatically created and available for use.

examples.description: Scroll around a picture using the mouse, stop scrolling when the left mouse button is down.

short_description: Returns true if the camera is active, else returns false.
tips: - The camera is automatically turned on at the start of each `draw()` loop.
